ciss_vae.utils.run_cissvae.cluster_on_missing_prop

cluster_on_missing_prop(prop_matrix, *, n_clusters=None, seed=None, min_cluster_size=None, cluster_selection_epsilon=0.25, metric='euclidean', scale_features=False)[source]

Cluster data based on their per-sample missingness proportions.

Groups data with similar patterns of missingness across samples, treating each feature as a point in the space of per-sample missingness rates. Useful for identifying features that are missing together systematically.

Parameters:

  • prop_matrix (pandas.DataFrame or numpy.ndarray) – Matrix where rows are samples, columns are features, entries are missingness proportions [0,1]

  • n_clusters (int, optional) – Number of clusters for KMeans; if None, uses HDBSCAN, defaults to None

  • seed (int, optional) – Random seed for KMeans reproducibility, defaults to None

  • min_cluster_size (int, optional) – HDBSCAN minimum cluster size; if None, uses max(2, n_features//25), defaults to None

  • cluster_selection_epsilon (float, optional) – HDBSCAN cluster selection threshold, defaults to 0.25

  • metric (str, optional) – Distance metric (“euclidean” or “cosine”), defaults to “euclidean”

  • scale_features (bool, optional) – Whether to standardize feature vectors before clustering, defaults to False

Returns:

Tuple of (feature_cluster_labels, silhouette_score)

Return type:

tuple[numpy.ndarray, float or None]

Raises:

  • ImportError – If scikit-learn or hdbscan dependencies are not installed

  • ValueError – If prop_matrix is not 2D or contains invalid values
